Roast Chicken with Crispy Potatoes and Salsa Verde Recipe | Bon Appetit




















































Close Menu IconLoginRecipesCookingCultureShoppingRestaurantsBA MarketVideosPodcastSubscribe to our newsletterSign UpPrivacy and user agreementMain Navigation IconBA LogoBon appetitLoginSPONSOREDRoast Chicken with Crispy Potatoes and Salsa VerdeSponsored by The Home DepotFacebookPinterestTwitterEmail4 servingsAir fryers are exceptionally good at turning out perfect, crispy-meets-creamy roast potatoes.
Recipe by Christina ChaeyPrintIngredients1 3½–4 lb. whole chicken, patted dry¾ cup plus 3 Tbsp. extra-virgin olive oil, dividedKosher salt, freshly ground black pepper1 lemon, halved½ cup flat-leaf parsley leaves with tender stems, roughly chopped¼ cup cilantro leaves with tender stems, roughly chopped¼  cup sliced chives2 Tbsp. mint leaves, roughly chopped¼  cup white wine vinegar1 small shallot, roughly chopped1 jalapeño, seeded and roughly chopped1 garlic clove, smashed1½ lb. small potatoes, halvedRecipe PreparationPlace a rack in middle of oven; preheat to 425°. Set chicken in a 12” cast-iron skillet and rub all over with 1 Tbsp. olive oil. Season generously with salt and pepper. Insert lemon halves into chicken cavity. Tie legs together with kitchen twine.Roast chicken in oven until skin is golden brown and crisp all over and an instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of breast registers 160°, 60–80 minutes. Let chicken rest in skillet at least 15 minutes and up to 45 minutes before transferring to a cutting board and carving.Blend herbs, vinegar, shallot, jalapeño, garlic, and ¾ cup oil in a blender until mixture is still slightly chunky and you can still see flecks of herbs. Transfer salsa verde to a small bowl and season with salt.Set air fryer to 400°. Toss potatoes with 2 Tbsp. oil and season with salt and pepper. Add potatoes to air fryer basket and cook for 12-15 minutes, tossing every 5 minutes, until golden brown and crisp.Transfer carved chicken to a platter and arrange potatoes around.
